biography: Einav Peretz-Andersson is a Senior Lecturer and Researcher at the School of Engineering, Jönköping University, Sweden, where she also serves as Program Manager for the Master’s programme in AI Engineering. Her research focuses on AI-driven organizational transformation: how organizations build the strategic, cultural, and operational capabilities needed to adopt AI responsibly at scale. She studies AI adoption and data-driven decision-making, explainable AI (XAI) as a foundation for trust and accountability, and AI governance structures in both public and private sector organizations. With a multidisciplinary background spanning engineering, innovation, and policy-oriented research, Einav bridges academic rigor with practical relevance to support responsible, sustainable, and inclusive digital transformation. She leads interdisciplinary and international research collaborations with institutions such as the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU), Università degli Studi di Udine (Italy), and Luleå University of Technology.
researchInterests: AI transformation and AI maturity: how strategy, structure, processes, culture, people, and technology co-evolve with AI adoption.
Explainable AI (XAI) and human-centered AI: transparency, interpretability, and decision accountability in organizational contexts.
AI governance and responsible AI: governance models, ethics, risk, and compliance practices for large-scale AI implementation.
Data-driven decision-making and operating models: designing roles, routines, and capabilities for AI-enabled work.
Ecosystem collaboration for digital and circular transitions: how cross-actor coordination enables transformation beyond single organizations.

featuredPublications.name: Artificial intelligence implementation in manufacturing SMEs: A resource orchestration approach
featuredPublications.description: This study examines how manufacturing SMEs orchestrate resources for AI implementation. Findings show how SMEs acquire and accumulate AI resources, bundle them into learning and governance capabilities, and mobilize technologies, processes, and skilled people to enable AI-enabled transformation.

currentProjects.name: AI Transformation & AI Maturity in Organizations
currentProjects.description: Conceptualizing AI transformation as a distinct form of organizational transformation, integrating strategy, structure, processes, culture, people, and technology. Focus on how organizations develop maturity through capability building and cultural adaptation.

currentProjects.name: Explainable AI (XAI) and Trustworthy Decision-Making
currentProjects.description: Investigating how explainability practices, interpretability requirements, and human-centered design support accountability and trust in AI-enabled decision-making across organizational settings.

currentProjects.name: AI Governance for Responsible Implementation
currentProjects.description: Designing governance structures, roles, and policies that help organizations manage strategic, ethical, legal, and operational risks associated with large-scale AI adoption—especially in public sector and regulated contexts.
